e4: Changing to the new policy eliminates long-standing bias, upholds transparency and accuracy in financial reporting, and aligns the company with ethical standards. While it may cause confusion initially, it ultimately builds trust with investors and mitigates possible legal risks from biased reporting practices, benefiting all stakeholders in the long term.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and honesty in financial disclosures. It ensures all material information is reported without bias to enable informed investor decisions. The policy should comply with regulations, protect investor interests equally, and strive to minimize information asymmetry between sophisticated and retail investors. Accountability and consistency are key.
e6: Yes. How does management plan to communicate the change in policy to ensure investors understand its implications? What strategies will be implemented to manage potential short-term market reactions? Also, what measures will be taken to support retail investors' understanding of the new reporting policy?
